com.mattrader.common

Class TickerCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mattrader.common.TickerCom

  • public class TickerCom
extends java.lang.Object
    TL;DR This is the main class, has ton of features!

    [ draft ]

    It provides methods for opening and closing services.
    It give you methods to handle OrderCom orders, SessionDBCom,

        public void openService(java.lang.String service)

        Parameters:
        service - - a String describing what service

      • getOrderList

        public java.util.ArrayList<com.mattrader.common.OrderCom> getOrderList()
        Not working already!!!
        Returns:
        a view of the internal list of orders connected to this ticker. The returned list is baked to the internal list of orders, so any change is reflected to both lists.

      • getSession

        public com.mattrader.common.SessionDBCom getSession()
        Returns:
        the session database for this ticker. This is a reference, so any update to prices or book levels of this ticker are reflected into returned session.

      • getStock

        public com.mattrader.common.StockCom getStock()
        Returns:
        a reference to the stock. Any update that will happen to the stock will be reflected in the reference obtained by a call to this method. Data contained in the stock are not real time data but may suffer some delays.

        To catch updates to stock use onStockUpdateEventManager()

        A call to this method force update informations stored into the returned StockCom object

      • hist

        public com.mattrader.common.HistoricalTableCom hist(int days,
                                                    java.lang.String period)
        Request a table view of the past days
        Parameters:
        days - - number of days (day)
        period - - the granularity ("s", "m", "h", "D")
        Returns:
        an empty HistoricalTableCom that will be populated when data become available

      • hist

        public com.mattrader.common.HistoricalTableCom hist(java.lang.String date,
                                                    java.lang.String period,
                                                    int number)
        Request a table view of financial values with a specified granularity, with a defined maximum number of rows up to a specified date. The number of rows is less or equal the number of rows requested ie. ticker.hist(datestr(now,'yyyymmddHHMMSS'),'m',40) give information on the last 40 minutes in which some transactions occurred.
        Parameters:
        date - a String containing the reference time, matlab format: yyyymmddHHMMSS
        period - the granularity ("s", "m", "h", "D")
        number - the number of raw desired
        Returns:
        an empty HistoricalTableCom that will be populated when data become available or null if an error occurred

      • hist

        public com.mattrader.common.HistoricalTableCom hist(java.lang.String dayTimeB,
                                                    java.lang.String dayTimeE,
                                                    java.lang.String period)
        Request a table view of the past days
        Parameters:
        dayTimeB - - starting dayTime (String DATETIME)
        dayTimeE - - ending dayTime (String DATETIME)
        period - - the granularity ("s", "m", "h", "D")
        Returns:
        an empty HistoricalTableCom that will be populated when data become available
